definition: to understand tacitly (idiom)/to know intuitively/to understand thoroughly
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: "Yes, " she answered, with an air of quiet understanding.
sentences.chinese: “是的，”她回答，露出心领神会的神气。

sentences.english: I'd tell a joke in Fuling and the people would get it.
sentences.chinese: 在涪陵我可以讲个笑话，而人们总是心领神会。

sentences.english: A smile from a heart can only be realised by a heart, it allows no words in between.
sentences.chinese: 会心的微笑，只能心领神会，非文章词句所能表达。

sentences.english: Twins intuitively understand each other and use shortened sentences and words when they talk.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们心领神会，谈话时只需简短的句子和言词。

sentences.english: Sam understands tacitly. He hoists his cup saying.
sentences.chinese: 山姆心领神会，举起酒杯。

sentences.english: When a horse neighs or paws the ground, the other horses get the message .
sentences.chinese: 当一匹马嘶鸣或以蹄扒地，其它的马心领神会。

definition: combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书[liu4 shu1] of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds/to comprehend without being told explicitly/to cotton on/knowing (smile, glance etc)
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
signal made with one's eyes/meaningful glance
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to whisper in sb's ear/a whisper
not show one's feeling or intentions
